newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani Shi'ite Moslem militant shot dead.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani Shi'ite Moslem militant shot dead.

text.p: Gunmen killed an activist of a Shi'ite Moslem militant group near the town of Multan in Pakistan's Punjab province, police said on Thursday.
A police spokesman said unidentified gunmen fired on Barkat Ali and his nephew Abid Askari as they rode a motorcycle in Chichawatni town 130 km (81 miles) east of Multan on Wednesday.
Ali, a local leader of the Shi'ite Sipah-i-Mohammad Pakistan (SMP) group, died on the spot. Askari was taken to hospital in Multan in critical condition with six bullet wounds.
A doctor said one bullet had hit Askari in the head and he was on a life support system.
There was no immediate claim of responsibility, but local followers of the SMP said they believed that the militant Sunni Moslem Sipah-i-Sahaba Pakistan group was behind the attack.

Sunni-Shi'ite disputes over Islamic beliefs have often spilled into violence in Pakistan. Wednesday's killing follows a series of sectarian attacks this year in the central province of Punjab and the southern province of Sindh.
Sunnis dominate Pakistan's population of about 130 million people, of which Shi'ites constitute about 15 percent.
